website_summaries.verdict: While experienced installers find hooking up these recessed lights straightforward, casual do-it-yourselfers may grumble a bit. Works reliably when paired with recommended LED lights.
pros: Quick-connect feature in wiring harness makes hooking up to electrical wiring much easier
Work well with recommended LED lights, available separately
Experienced installers find installation fairly straightforward
cons: To install, users will likely need to make any existing ceiling fixture holes bigger
Not UL-certified and may be risky to install in homes built before 1985
Screw-in lights can’t be used, limiting lighting options

customer_reviews.title: Im an electrician and these cans are great to install
customer_reviews.text: Im an electrician and these cans are great to install. The clips are not held in by sticker like another post mentions. The sticker is a gasket to prevent air leak into plenum. Will order again when I replace old flourecent fixtures in my kitchen. I will also recommend these to my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Resi Sparky

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE LOOK AT THE PICTURES OF PRODUCT BEFORE BUYING.
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE LOOK AT THE PICTURES OF PRODUCT BEFORE BUYING. This set does not have the light bulb screw-in type. Its just the can with the wire and an adapter that didn't fit the LED Lights i bought at LOWES. I did not see this before buying, just saw a 6 pack at a good price and got it, then I realized once the can was in the ceiling. I had to remove the adapter and use a wire nut. It works ok and product is what it is, Just double check the pictures and make sure that is exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: AngelV

customer_reviews.title: Great housings,  easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Work great easy to install. The orange connector goes to your fixture, plug and play. The 3 wire connectors are easy to daisy chain your AWG. 3 pieces of advice: 1. use wire strippers, lost mine in the attic & found out the hard way that snips create a weak point in AWG that will break off inside connector. 2. Stuck wire unscrews out, the hole in the connector is not a release. 3.test your hole saw. 4.25" dia. is a little snug getting past the bend, but will go with some force. Try 4.375-4.5" depending on the thickness of your drywall.
customer_reviews.author: s.graham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price, works and looks fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic and beat the price of any can you get at the big box stores. These work perfect with the SUNCO lights available on Amazon. The only issue with these cans and the lights is the same hotdog and the hotdog bun issue (they dont sell them in the same size packages) My electrician loves these and is now purchasing them for his company to install instead of the ones he was using. Price is great, quality great, only minor issue is locking them into the ceiling takes a little practice and getting used to, the electricians helper had a little challenge, but I figured it out as a DIYer so its not a really an issue
customer_reviews.author: robert s boham

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I didn't need all the cans. Packaging was unacceptable to the point one of the cans was crushed and unusable. I would definitely have returned them had I needed all six. I am confused at this point as the instructions say to cut a 6-1/2 inch hole in the ceiling. They also say to use the included template to cut the hole. The template is only 6-1/4 inches diameter. I'll have to decide which instruction to use before cutting any holes. I'll probably do the 6-1/4 inch hold as it's easier to make a hole larger than it is to make it smaller.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCO

customer_reviews.title: IC Rated, Easy to Connect, and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is now the 4th time I have installed these light cans throughout my properties and I absolutely love them. I do the work entirely by myself and I make videos on the installation. From my videos, I get comments from others that have copied me and they also love these products. They have quick connects that can hold a 12 or 14 gauge wire and are simple to connect compared to other ones that require a wiring nut and some extra hand strength. The hole you cut is 4 1/2 in" for the 4" lights. You just need to get the cans with these. All of this is in my video. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Concepts

customer_reviews.title: Good Can Light
customer_reviews.text: Nice Light, dont listen to the people who say to make the hole cut right at the size of the light. if you buy a 4" get a 4 3/8" hole saw. They make these specifically for can lights and can be found at most hardware stores. my only complaint was that the 4 locks were a battle. After installing about 12 of these in a day my thumbs were pretty worn out and raw. but it was a nice tight fit once they were in.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install but poorly written instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty good around the house fixing things. I installed some recessed light in my garage 20 years ago. Easy. I always read the instructions and the instructions included were really bad. It took me a while to play with the fixtures and then the next 11 were much easier. I would have given 5 stars but the simple instructions were poorly done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B

customer_reviews.title: remove old light fixture, cut 4" holes in the ...
customer_reviews.text: remove old light fixture, cut 4" holes in the ceiling for the new lights, be sure to use same gauge wiring that old fixture had (i.e. if 14 gauge, use 2+ground 14 gauge romex, or if 12 gauge use 2+ground 12 gauge romex). Hopefully it's 14 gauge (15 amp circuit); otherwise I'm not sure if supplied wire connectors will work with the heavier gauge. Very simple to install, each has it's own junction box, you will be daisy chaining them together. Comes complete with wire connectors, no need to supply your own wire nuts.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Stevick

customer_reviews.title: Wish i didn't but no other way around
customer_reviews.text: So i wish for my lythonia LED speaker lights that i didn't need this. Because you have down-lights without any can installation. But unfortunately i had to put cans to hold my LED lights. But that is not there problem. The can fitted good. And it did it's job. Happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Re-G Tromp

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are fantastic, they are so easy to install, no need to go into the attic (if you don't want to). The new connectors made wiring and install a breeze. Including the hole (using a hole saw) I think I installed each "can" in no more than 10 minutes each! I will be retrofitting more areas of my house because these are so easy, especially when paired with the Sunco Ltd LED 11W 4" bulbs...really bright white light...Perfect for our kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: vivirus

customer_reviews.title: Good quality housing
customer_reviews.text: Good quality housing, seems solid. Have yet to install but all the bits and pieces are there. Arrived quick and no damage to any piece. To reiterate the sellers description, these ARE NOT lights, you need to buy the lights separate. These are the housings that the lights will eventually install into. I get frustrated reading reviews where people don't understand what they are buying, and then poorly rate the seller for their own oversight.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector 1

customer_reviews.title: Quick, fast installation.
customer_reviews.text: Lights worked exactly as they should. It contained a stick-on template for the hole that you need to cut. Plug and play connectors for easy installation of several lights on a single circuit. I would buy again. TIP: When securing the 4 feet which secure the light onto the drywall, push them up with your fingers and then use a flathead screw driver to snug them up. They are very secure.
customer_reviews.author: nicks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent housing for adding recessed lighting to a home
customer_reviews.text: Very well made recessed lighting housing. All the necessary wiring and hardware are included. The most time consuming portion of the installation was measuring, cutting the holes, and running the wiring to each housing. The actual installation of the housings and electrical connections were simple. I will probably purchase the 5" housings for an installation at another home.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Solid units look great
customer_reviews.text: Solid cans, great build quality. Nice white powdercoat - not that you see them with the luminaires in place but adds to that feeling of quality. I found the clips a little hard to latch into place but I had 3/4 inch ceilings which I suspect was the culprit. All said, if I was installing four inch cans again I'd definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 12 so far, will likely buy 24 more over time.
customer_reviews.text: I jerry-rig these to fit my needs, but I've bought 12 of them and will end up buying a lot more. I like them a lot! If you want and need something cheap that can get the job done, this is a good way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Remrie Arrie

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights nice price
customer_reviews.text: Nice can and nice lights. I got the 27k light color (orange) and they look great. 4 lights were bright enough for my 12x12 bedroom. Bought a adjustable hole cutter at H Depot and a fiberglass wire running kit that electricians use to run wire and finished my bedroom in a few hours! Remember start them 24”in away from walls. I spaced them 6-7’ft apart for a 8-9’ft ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: mrguzman25

customer_reviews.title: A must for any remodel lighting needs
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing a remodel these are the perfect choice. Easy install with a 6" hole saw and plug and play wiring. Do not forget to get the led lights to go with these. I just installed them into my kitchen and they are beautiful and bright! Sorry for the mess but as I said; remodel.
customer_reviews.author: Jax B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: These things are crazy easy to work with. Do yourself a favor and buy a 6.5 inch hole saw. Installed six of these in about 45 mins. Took me longer to run the wires in the attic then it did to install these.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT - A +++ - Full recommended
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours doing a full research in order to get the best model with the best price and THIS IS THE WINNER. Aside from Amazon, I also went to Home Depot and Lowes looking for options and, believe me, there is no competition at all (Price + quantiy + quality). It is also versatile: because of some AC ducts over my roof, I had to take off the metallic part from two of the cans with no problem and it worked like a charm... I combined it with Hyperikon 9W 4 Inch LED ( EXCELLENT PRODUCT - A +++
customer_reviews.author: Moranges

customer_reviews.title: These worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: These worked like a charm. Some things you may want to know: They are difficult to lock into the ceiling when they are next to rafters. There is a small square rectangle to lock the romex cable in place. You should use that "lock" to protect your romex
customer_reviews.author: FunGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use remodeling can.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use remodeling can. The can is air tight and locks in tight if you cut the appropriate sized hole. Come with push in wire connectors for even easier install.
customer_reviews.author: john kindig

customer_reviews.title: Makes a differance
customer_reviews.text: These lights were so easy to install. With the wire connectors to all lights you just push in the wire. Then your wire jumps from light to light. The attic is never easy to work in, but the light install was simple. The difference in overall appearance in kitchen is amazing. And the amount of light was more than enough. I also installed a dimmer switch, which is a great touch.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty well constructed cans
customer_reviews.text: Are you tired of the big box brands where the aluminum housing bends and tears as you push in the clamps? Nice heavy duty design. The can doesn't flex and clams onto the ceiling. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ed

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I received them one of the metal cans were bent, but after some minor elbow grease got it fixed enough that the recessed light could fit flush in the can.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Flie

customer_reviews.title: Easy install at a great price
customer_reviews.text: All around great cans that are easy to install. Had no issues with the clips. however when cutting the hole, I would recommend cutting about a 1/16th of an inch outside the tracing lines. Fit was a bit tight at the exact size of the template. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good surviceable 4" LED Remodel Can
customer_reviews.text: I used these in kitchen to provide 4" recessed cans for Elite 4" LED modules. Worked well with my 1/2" drywall ceiling, but may not work with a thicker ceiling. Junction box has quick-connect fasteners for attaching romex cabling. Installation went quick and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm installing into kitchen overhead
customer_reviews.text: Had one previous pot light break when replacing bulb . Ordered six pack (needed 5) cheaper than local source for 5. Removed earlier type, these then slipped up into kitchen 4" overhead no mess, little cussing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr V

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU! So easy to wire and install.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe how easy these were to install. The wiring was made easy due to the adapters on these housings. Color coded and just overall very easy to install my Sunco LED lights. Seriously thank you. It was a breeze and my living room looks amazing. I would definitely buy again and recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Beaupre

customer_reviews.title: we love them. At first we ordered the light bulbs ...
customer_reviews.text: we love them. At first we ordered the light bulbs thinking that we were getting the cans. I was ready to return them when I got an email asking if I liked them. I explained the problem and they told me to order these cans. They look great in our kitchen. The ceiling looks taller and much nicer than the florescent lights we had
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with these can lights
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these remodel can lights. I have installed these several times in the past from both big box stores and they were not as well built or as easy to install as these from Sunco. When I have more in the future to install. This will be my go-to brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: The clips can be hard to install. You may ...
customer_reviews.text: The clips can be hard to install. You may have to remove the clips. Bend them outward, then use a flat head screw driver to widen the slit at the top where the clip goes in. Then press the clip in and upward. Once the clip is flat against the housing, use a flat head screw driver to push it up and secure. The extra padding/insulation is to make it air-tight. I didn't realize what they were for at first, but they go around the base/outside of the housing. Same for the padding on the clips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... which happened to be Sunco recessed lights and we love them! My husband says they are extremely easy ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are rehabbing a house that we are going to move into and I found these housing for the lights we bought which happened to be Sunco recessed lights and we love them! My husband says they are extremely easy to use and install. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Karla Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for old construction
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for old construction. They go up easy. My suggestion for you is to get a hole saw and set it to the diameter it makes the job SO easy. I put three in my hallway and two in my closet. Don’t forget to get the lights in addition the the cans though.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These lights are good value, the only negative I would have it the mounting clip...they are a little difficult to keep in place in tight quarters. I had to drill and mount a small bolt for one of them to stay in place. Other than that, they seem to work great and good value for the 6 packs
customer_reviews.author: DND

customer_reviews.title: Make certain, before ordering, that they will be compatible with your trim kit to be paired with.
customer_reviews.text: These are what they are shown to be. Easy to install for the diyer. One does not have to be an electrician to install, however the instructions are not as thorough as could be for someone who has never installed these. Some basic knowledge is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi W

customer_reviews.title: Work great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: They work well. The installation was easy. Locking them was easy. The electrical connection was very easy as well. Overall I am very satisfied with this purchase and have since bought more.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Reynaldo Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Installation is not as easy as the Halo housing
customer_reviews.text: Installation is not as easy as the Halo housing. The three metal locking pieces will not hammer in unless they are in a good position. Tip: open the 4" hole slightly larger to allow the metal locking pieces to go down when hammering in
customer_reviews.author: Bunz

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of these in 2 houses and I really like them. Do yourself a favor and get the drill powered circle drywall cutter. Don't do it by hand!
customer_reviews.author: Cody B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I’ve installed 18 of these throw out house, and no problems with any of them. Just as good, if not better than Halos available at local home improvement store, and about half the price
customer_reviews.author: Picky

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very tough to move the clips when installing in wood lath and plaster ceiling. I expect they install just right in a drywall ceiling. I used 4 3/8 hole saw and I believe that to be the best hole size.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've installed probably 300 recessed can lights in the past couple years. And the quality of this product is much better than the main brand sold at the Big Orange and Big Blue Box stores. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Playbent

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install elegant looking, quality product. Tip - when locking the legs push down then slide up will ensure they remain in place.
customer_reviews.author: Keeping it Real

customer_reviews.title: Use this canister with the Hyperikon LED downlight
customer_reviews.text: This Sunco recessed light canister for old work remodel jobs works very well with the Hyperikon LED downlight also sold by Amazon. Get them both; you'll be pleased with the ease of installation and the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S

customer_reviews.title: Blows away home depot and lowes
customer_reviews.text: Better price, better quality. As an electrician I can honestly say this product is superior. Used them in my kids rooms and regret not using them sooner. Always use them for customers.
customer_reviews.author: Benedict Oliveri

customer_reviews.title: Superior product!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Last forever, easy to install and look great. Can't beat the price! I've purchased a few dozen of these lights at different wattages and have NEVER had any problems with any of them. I've purchased both the lights and cans and both are excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: and they always work fantastic. When clipping
customer_reviews.text: Have used these in multiple rooms in my house which is a plaster construction, and they always work fantastic. When clipping, just use a screw driver to push the clip up for the extra thickness (5/8"-3/4" in my house). Would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Good-Looking LED Can
customer_reviews.text: I don't fancy myself as an electrician, but these housings were easy to wire, easy to install in the ceiling, and look great. Highly recommend to anyone looking to do a can replacement or a new install. One word of caution: when installing, be sure to space your can at least 1" (one inch) from the nearest joist. The securing "arms" of the can need some room to swing out/down and lock into the sheetrock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great option.
customer_reviews.text: I installed four of these in one bedroom and they look great. If you don't want the size of a 6" can, I highly recommend these. I wish the clips were a little easier to secure but since this was my first time installing recessed lighting, maybe it's a common issue.
customer_reviews.author: NJMonark1

customer_reviews.title: works great and feels like good quality
customer_reviews.text: works great and feels like good quality, worked with sunco lighting 11 wat 4 inch energy and it worked well. Loved that I put a dimmer switch on there so I can get a soft light to a very bright, Thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: CREATIONS BY CHRISTY

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With These
customer_reviews.text: These are a great buy. They worked well because their design allows you to cut the hole and do a lot of the installation from below. They lock in place securely. The construction is solid and the price is about as low as you're going to find. I bought the 4" LED's from Costco for about $12/pair.
customer_reviews.author: SheetMetalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, snap right in, easy wiring. Was great to work with. Install 4 in master bedroom. With Philips lighting looks awesome. These cans are great. Snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Perrella

customer_reviews.title: EASY INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy installation. They slip right in whole and lock in place. Had issue with a couple of retainer clips. Contact the manufacture and he rushed replacements out the next day. AWSOME customer service.
customer_reviews.author: captrigo

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Junction boxes are nice with nice quick ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Junction boxes are nice with nice quick connectors. Just push in your wire and jump over to the next can. Paired with recommended LED 3000k lights. Awesome light!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and work well
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. Seem to be of high quality, easy to install, and work great - no reason to think these won't last a long time - but time will tell. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Suss

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to get job done easy to install
customer_reviews.author: zhaochengyang

customer_reviews.title: Product is solid and will serve its purpose. Installation ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is solid and will serve its purpose. Installation was fairly simple. Main downside to these is trying to get the metal feet to stay in place. They do not "lock" in as expected, so over the course of the installation the cans would slip down and have to be reset.
customer_reviews.author: JackOfSpades

customer_reviews.title: Sunco Lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very well built, easy to install. Wiring already have push wire connectors inside junction box. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this type of light cans several times and I like them easy to install
customer_reviews.author: JG ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Well made cans
customer_reviews.text: Well made cans, much better quality than big box store, versatile connection options rugged construction and solid mounting, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Harrelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy connectors
customer_reviews.text: Came on time, solid product, was easy to install. The electrical snaps we're easy to work with. Had my 6 new light connected and working in about an hour. I replaced my hallogen lights with these ones. These are much easier and looked better.
customer_reviews.author: Vasia

customer_reviews.title: Best deal in the USA
customer_reviews.text: What a No Brainer! Best deal in the USA! Averages out to $9;00 a can and are IC rated. You won't find a better deal anywhere. Making America great again! Thank you Sunco!!

customer_reviews.title: Could not have been easier to install
customer_reviews.text: Came with push-in connectors for the wire ends, which made the installation quick. I agree that it isn't exactly obvious how the foam sticker strips should be used, but even so... 5 stars. The only advice I can give is to make sure you double-check where your studs are and if possible make sure the outside of your can is about 2 inches from the stud to ensure room for engaging the clips. My first row was only an inch away from the stud and it was a challenge to lock in the clips. One other thing... I used an adjustable drywall hole cutter with the plastic dust catcher. Worth the $25 and made the job super tidy.
customer_reviews.author: T Robin

customer_reviews.title: I love the low profile and bright lighting
customer_reviews.text: I have converted most of the lighting in the house to these. I love the low profile and bright lighting. I have included a scan of the spec sheet that comes with the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: good company
customer_reviews.text: We bought both can and recessed lights from Sunco Lighting. The shipment came very fast and the transactions are very smooth. The products' qualities are good.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Su

customer_reviews.title: Great Cans!
customer_reviews.text: I installed about 20 of these in my house. Excellent product. Easy to install, nice tight fit when using a 6 3/8 hole saw. Very easy to retrofit even when next to a stud.
customer_reviews.author: MaksV

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These were just outstanding to install. Since they were nearly half the cost of those I'd previously used via the big box stores, my expectations were rather modest. But there actually superior IMHO. The mounting clips were better quality (hence easier to install) & the cans were painted instead of just raw aluminum, which also made the insertion into the ceiling easier. Just a superior product all around.
customer_reviews.author: bret

customer_reviews.title: These were great! I wanted the air tight version and something ...
customer_reviews.text: These were great! I wanted the air tight version and something that I didn't have to worry when the attic insulation came up against it. The price was perfect and they seemed very durable. Much better for me than the thin metal cans.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So nice, I bought them twice!
customer_reviews.text: I used a dozen of these in a remodeling project, and liked them so much that I just bought a dozen more for my new project. They work great, seal up tightly so no air leakage, and look great.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Whitesel

customer_reviews.title: would buy again
customer_reviews.text: easy install after laying out.make sure to cut close to line and they fit great.bought the dimmable LEDsto go with and provide plenty of light.I also added 3 way dimmable lutron dimmers.
customer_reviews.author: J.brooks

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After 6 month 2 bulbs are out already. Now it's a already a year and I needed to change all 6 lights.
customer_reviews.author: M. FBP

customer_reviews.title: snapped in place just fine
customer_reviews.text: Great material quality and snapped in place fine. Wiring them up was tough though.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! We installed them on the Eves of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Buy! We installed them on the Eves of our home with separately purchased bulbs which are LED inserts. The cans are well-made and are definitely a very nice purchase. A quality product! Packaging was Secure and arrived when promised.
customer_reviews.author: tbielert

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Locks are a little tricky, but everything else is great
customer_reviews.author: J stew

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very good light fixture and very good price
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very good light fixture and very good price. I have been using Sunco lighting for a few months now because of the extremely competitive price and good product. One issue that I've had which is discouraging is regarding the 5 to 6 inch LED trims. The mounting clips pop off when trying to put them into the can and makes it impossible to secure the trim to the can. The clip should be secured In a more significant way to the trims so they wont pop off while squeezing them to push them up in to the can. Other than that I love the old work cans and LED trims...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clips Don't Work Well
customer_reviews.text: The clips that hold them in place are difficult to snap in place. A few snap easily but most do not.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Zeis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Sunco Remodel Housing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, arrived in perfect condition. Good price. Would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Very good price and fast delivery as always with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Very good price and fast delivery as always with Amazon. Some of the clips were a little hard to snap in to place but I managed to get them locked. Fun project for this 55 year old grandmother!
customer_reviews.author: indidawn

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and are as promised. Will update once installed.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and products arrived on time and are as promised. Haven't installed the units yet because home is still under construction. Will update this review once they have been installed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I have purchased & installed over 100 of these for customers & for my own. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: armbac52

customer_reviews.title: Love These Lights
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my newly remodeled kitchen... we put them on a dimmer and they work beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: LINDAB

customer_reviews.title: Great Item!
customer_reviews.text: Great Item! ... Does exactly what I need it to do. Great item at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality cans. 4 1/4" hole saw works fine
customer_reviews.text: Great product, nice cans. Electric boxes are a smidge small, but nothing to complain about. 4 1/4" hole saw will work (I had one from the other cans I put in), though you have to push/shove a little to get the ends of the clips to push through the hole. A 4 1/2" hole saw is the recommended size.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mongue

customer_reviews.title: They're good but lack cable clamps
customer_reviews.text: Nice can. Use more wire than you think you need though. The bar stick out far causing you to use at least 12" on subsequent tie ins, also these lack Romex wire compression clamps on the box. Only down sides about the design of these.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Paradiso

customer_reviews.title: Sunco lighting 6 pack
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product and works the way it should.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Viray

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful price and product for recessed lighting
customer_reviews.text: Recently had these professionally installed and the electrician even commented on the great quick connect features.
customer_reviews.author: Zachattack

customer_reviews.title: Terrible as we all know
customer_reviews.text: We had fluorescent lights. Terrible as we all know. These lights make all the difference in the world. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Juhl

customer_reviews.title: Well made cans!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and I really like the way they installed. No need to mount to wood.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Easy to Install!
customer_reviews.text: Have been very satisfied with Sunco Lights. Installed both remodel and new construction cans and they are easy and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: C68

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product make sure to buy both cans and light s
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Solid lights
customer_reviews.text: The lights are pretty sturdy and the clips work better than some more expensive brands. For me a hole slightly smaller than the recommended provided a much better fit. The recommended 4 1/2" had some lights slipping a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffmguida

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to wire and a good product for latest ...
customer_reviews.text: Great easy to wire and a good product for latest LCD lamps (note these have NO socket for regular bulbs), struggle to engage clips in older ceilings (lath and plaster) but a breeze on drywall. These meet the latest standard for energy efficiency
customer_reviews.author: A. Evans

customer_reviews.title: The cans are very easy to install (the all have clips for wire installation
customer_reviews.text: The cans are very easy to install (the all have clips for wire installation, so no wire nuts needed, also there is a direct connect to the LED so no pigtail adapter to a traditional screw in socket needed) and are well made. This was my 5th project using 4” can lights on an existing structure and I wished I had used these on all my previous work.
customer_reviews.author: Reinhard Pollach

customer_reviews.title: This are cheaply made, hard to install devices that ...
customer_reviews.text: This are cheaply made, hard to install devices that come with zero instructions. WARNING: the clips will NOT hold the canisters in place if the drywall is thicker than half an inch. Hire a professional, or choose a different brand. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Stew

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Knock outs for electrical fitting are near impossible to remove the 1/2” Had to remove 3/4” than add washers to accommodate 1/2” fitting. (Metal to thin). It’s a good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Easy to install and they work great. The included hole template has a sticky back which made it very easy to move them around to see where I wanted the lights.
customer_reviews.author: B. Guffey

customer_reviews.title: Our electrician had nothing but good things to say on the quality of these housings
customer_reviews.text: Our electrician had nothing but good things to say on the quality of these housings. They fit very snugly in 6 3/8" hole, but would probably be best in a 6.5".
customer_reviews.author: Eric Brookfield

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and great price
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for my lighting project. Being new to this type of DIY project, of course we ran into some placement issues of the cans. Wiring was simple with the connectors. The clips securing the cans to the drywall gave me some difficulty at first, but got the knack of it. Price was significantly better than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUY 4" REMODEL CAN
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built unit, it is easy to install and much less expensive than the halo brand. Note that the connection is a plug in wire connector and does not have a medium base bulb socket. That unit comes with the LED retrofit units.
customer_reviews.author: FLETCH

customer_reviews.title: 4 1/4" Hole Saw Required
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I was having a difficult time finding 6 packs (4") at my local home improvement stores at this price point. They carried 6" packs all day long. Only reason 4 of 5 is that the recessed hole size requires 4 1/4". You'll have to buy the correct hole saw. or be ready to open hole larger by sanding or other...I chose to use by 2" expanded drum sander until my correct hole saw arrived. Everything else about the product is solid and sound. I will be buying additional packs to finish my project.
customer_reviews.author: cb51dad

product_meta.title: Sunco Lighting 6 Pack of 4" inch Remodel LED Can Air Tight IC Housing LED Recessed Lighting- UL Listed and Title 24 Certified
feature_bullets: ✅ AIR TIGHT & IC RATED - Sunco's remodel cans are airtight and thermally protected and designed to be installed in the ceiling surrounded by insulation. Sunco's cans won't overheat and cause a fire in the roof or overhead joist space. Airtight design keeps air conditioning or heating from leaking out of the home through the housing.

✅ SIMPLE INSTALL - Follow our easy instruction guide for a fast and secure setup! Sunco's direct wire remodel cans with junction box are secured by inserting the can into the existing opening in the ceiling and pushing metal remodeling clips into the ceiling drywall or plaster to hold the can in place. TP24 connector included.

✅ UL & TITLE 24 - We uphold the highest standards for all our products by testing each product for optimal performance and safety. Our remodel housing are compliant with Title 24 energy efficiency standards.
✅ SUNCO BENEFITS - 10-Year Warranty! Sunco is proudly based in the USA, offering quality products at affordable prices backed by industry-leading warranties and knowledgeable support specialists.
